Support the development and execution of a comprehensive performance management strategy to enable leadership to effectively monitor and manage the Global IT Procurement function's health. In addition, work with the internal business units (IT, Procurement, Finance) to understand forward looking budget across Laureate and execute an over-arching strategy to deliver targeted savings, quality, and reliability while meeting the business needs of the organization.
This includes ensuring the use of contracts where possible, directing strategic sourcing initiatives, managing supplier relationships, and developing strong working relationships to understand and meet IT procurement related targets and business needs.

Work closely with Laureate institutions globally to implement products and services aimed to increase academic quality, reduce operational cost and online market readiness. This includes implementing online standards in terms of Digital Strategy, Faculty Development, Content, Technology, and overall Operations throughout the network, mainly focused in the Latin America region.
Also, supervision of the "Laureate Discover Project" which is a repository of academic tools and digital resources aimed to help Laureate institutions find, consume and collaborate content in the digital world. This includes:
- Project Management, including program budget management and monitoring of all Laureate Discover´s ongoing projects
- Procurement process management for all academic content acquired
- Marketing campaigns management, including marketing materials, brochures, newsletters, mass mailing, etc.
- CRM and Surveys management, including: Design, delivery and presentation of results for customer satisfaction surveys every six months
- Reporting: Quarterly Regional Executive Reports, Audit Reports, Manage Program metrics with Business Intelligence Tool, etc.
- Coordination and supervision of Events Logistics for Best Practices Events and Webinars globally
- Team Supervision
